text.text_translated:
Ed Stafford is from the UK.  
He was the first person to walk the whole Amazon River.  
He started at a small river in the Andes mountains of Peru.  
He reached the river mouth in Brazil.  
The walk took two years and four months.  
He walked about 6,000 kilometres.  
The Amazon forest has snakes that can kill you, crocodiles and jaguars.  
It was always not safe for Ed.  
Fortunately, he only got a few thousand bites from bugs.

feedback.feedback:
PASS: This text is an exemplary model of A2 simplification.

- Factual Integrity: All facts, numbers, and names from the original text are preserved with perfect accuracy.
- Metric Compliance: The text exceeds all metric requirements. The MeaningBERT score of 0.85 and BERTScore of 0.91 confirm that the core message and key details were successfully retained. The CEFR Classifier correctly identifies the output as A2.
- Vocabulary Control: Vocabulary is strictly confined to the A2 level. The simplification of 'poisonous' to the descriptive phrase 'that can kill you' is an excellent A2 strategy.
- Structural Simplification: The original text's longer sentences have been expertly deconstructed into short, simple sentences. This structure is ideal for A2 readability. The text demonstrates a complete and successful adherence to all A2 standards.

best_attempt.text_translated:
Ed Stafford is from the UK.  
He was the first person to walk the whole Amazon River.  
He started at a small stream in the Andes mountains of Peru.  
He reached the river mouth in Brazil.  
The walk took two years and four months.  
He walked about 6,000 kilometres.  
The Amazon rainforest has poisonous snakes, crocodiles and jaguar.  
So Ed was in constant risk.  
Fortunately, he only got many mosquito and ant bites.
